document.docAuthor: Khaustov, Alexander A., Shentu, Hsuan & Ho, Chyi-Chen
document.masterDocTitle: Redefinition of the genus Luciaphorus Mahunka, 1981 (Acari: Pygmephoridae) with redescription of L. perNiciosus Rack, 1983 and L. auriculariae Gao, Zou and Jiang, 1990

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redefinition of the genus Luciaphorus Mahunka, 1981 (Acari: Pygmephoridae) with redescription of L. perNiciosus Rack, 1983 and L. auriculariae Gao, Zou and Jiang, 1990

bibRefCitation.author: Rack
bibRefCitation.refString: Rack, G. (1983) Beschreibung einer in Thailand an Speisepilzen (Auricularia polytricha) schadlichen Milbe, Luciaphorus perniciosus sp. n. (Acari, Tarsonemina, Pygmephoridae). Folia Entomologica Hungarica, 44 (1), 139 - 146.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . FEMALE. SETAE h 1 AND h 2 WEAKLY BARBED AND MUcH LONGER THAN OTHER DORSAL SETAE, SETAE chb , dFe AND m ON GNATHOSOMA ABSENT, APODEMES 3 PRESENT, SETAE 1 a , 1 c , 2 a , AND 2 b WEAKLY BARBED, TIBIOTARSUS I SLIGHTLY THIcKER THAN GENU, SETA pv’ OF TIBIOTARSUS I SMOOTH AND BLUNT-ENDED, SETA d OF TIBIA III DISTINcTLY BLUNT-ENDED AND BRUSH-LIKE DISTALLY. MALE WITH SETAE sc 2 AND c 2 SMOOTH AND POINTED. SETA l’ OF GENU II NOT MODIFIED.
Redescription . FEMALE ( FIGS 1–3 , 7–9 ). LENGTH OF IDIOSOMA 130–135, WIDTH 82–85.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 .
Luciaphorus perniciosus Rack, 1983

FIGURE 4 .
Luciaphorus perniciosus Rack, 1983
, male: A—dorsum of the body, B—venter of the body. Legs omitted.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnathosoma
. LENGTH OF GNATHOSOMA 20–21, WIDTH 14–15. DORSAL MEDIAN APODEME ABSENT . SETAE cha 5 SMOOTH , POINTED ; SETAE chb ABSENT . SETA dGe POINTED , SMOOTH ; SETA dFe ABSENT . SUBcAPITULAR SETAE m ABSENT . PHARYNGEAL PUMP 2 SMOOTH .

Idiosomal dorsum ( FIGS 1A , 8A, C, E , 9A, C ). PRODORSAL SHIELD WITH LARGE DIMPLES IN ANTERIOR PART ( FIG. 8C ). OTHER DORSAL SHIELDS SMOOTH. SETAE h 1 AND h 2 WEAKLY BARBED, MUcH LONGER THAN OTHER DORSAL SETAE; SETAE
v 2
WITH FEW BARBS; OTHER DORSAL SETAE STRONGLY BARBED, ALMOST BRUSH-LIKE DISTALLY ( FIG. 9A ). CUPULES ia ON TERGITE D SITUATED ANTEROLATERALLY TO BASES OF SETAE d ; cUPULES im ON TERGITE EF SITUATED ANTERIORLY TO SETAE e ; cUPULES ih ON TERGITE H SITUATED JUST ANTEROLATERALLY TO BASES OF SETAE h 1. LENGTHS OF DORSAL SETAE: v 1 10–11 , v 2 8–9, sc 2 14–15 , c 1 11–12 , c 2 13–14 , d 13–15, e 13–14, f 13, h 1 45–50, h 2 49–51. DISTANcES BETWEEN SETAE: v 1 –v 1 20–22 ,
v 2 –v 2 34
–35, sc 2 –sc 2 46– 49, c 1– c 1 21–23 , c 1– c 2 20–22 , d–d 33–35, e–e 23–36, e–f 9–11, f–f 14–16, h 1– h 1 26–28 , h 1– h 2 5, h 2– h 2 35–36.

Idiosomal venter ( FIGS. 1B , 8B, D, F ). VENTRAL PLATES SMOOTH. VENTRAL SETAE 3 b AND 4 a WEAKLY BLUNT-ENDED AND SMOOTH; SETAE 1 a , 1 c , 2 a , 2 b WEAKLY BARBED AND POINTED; SETAE ps 3 DISTINcTLY BLUNT-ENDED AND BARBED ( FIG. 8F ); OTHER VENTRAL SETAE POINTED AND SMOOTH. AP3 REPRESENTED BY TWO WEAKLY ScLEROTIzED SLIGHTLY cURVED ScLERITES LOcATED JUST MEDIALLY TO SETAE 3 a AND ANTERIORLY TO SETAE 3 c ; AP4 VERY SHORT, NOT REAcHING BASES OF SETAE 3 b . LENGTHS OF VENTRAL SETAE: 1 a 17–18, 1 b 13–14, 1 c 19–21, 2 a 15–16, 2 b 15–16, 2 c 10–12, 3 a 8–10, 3 b 7–8, 3 c 15–16, 4 a 7–8, 4 b 15–17, 4 c 12–13, ps 1 6–8, ps 2 5–7, ps 3 8–9.

Legs (
FIGS . 2
, 3 , 7 , 9B, D ). LEG I (
FIGS . 2A
, 9B ). TIBIOTARSUS I ONLY SLIGHTLY THIcKER THAN GENU . LENGTHS OF SOLENIDIA ω 1 4, ω 2 3, φ 1 5, φ 2 3; ALL SOLENIDIA WEAKLY cLAVATE. SETAE l’ OF FEMUR AND pv’ OF TIBIOTARSUS BLUNT-ENDED AND SMOOTH ; OTHER SETAE OF LEG I (EXcEPT EUPATHIDIA) POINTED AND SPARSELY BARBED . LEG II ( FIG. 2B ). SOLENIDION ω 5 WEAKLY cLAVATE. SETA l’ OF FEMUR BLUNT-ENDED AND SMOOTH ; SETAE u’ AND tc” SMOOTH AND POINTED , OTHER LEG SETAE SPARSELY BARBED AND POINTED . LEG III (
FIGS . 3A
, 9D ). SETAE d OF FEMUR AND TIBIA DISTINcTLY BLUNT-ENDED AND STRONGLY BARBED ; SETA u’ SMOOTH AND POINTED ; OTHER SETAE POINTED AND SPARSELY BARBED . LEG IV ( FIG. 3B ). SETAE d OF FEMUR AND TIBIA DISTINcTLY BLUNT-ENDED AND STRONGLY BARBED ; SETAE v” OF TIBIA AND pl” BLUNT-ENDED AND SPARSELY BARBED ; OTHER LEG SETAE POINTED AND SPARSELY BARBED .
MALE ( FIGS 4–6 , 10 ). LENGTH OF IDIOSOMA 140–150, WIDTH 91–98.

Idiosomal dorsum ( FIGS 4A , 10A–C ). SETAE f WEAKLY BARBED; OTHER DORSAL SETAE SMOOTH. SETAE sc 2 AND c 2 POINTED, MUcH LONGER THAN OTHER DORSAL SETAE; OTHER DORSAL SETAE BLUNT-ENDED. CUPULES ia ON TERGITE CD SITUATED ANTERIORLY TO BASES OF SETAE d ; cUPULES im ON TERGITE EF SITUATED ANTERIORLY TO SETAE f . LENGTHS OF DORSAL SETAE:
v 1
4–5,
v 2
2–3, sc 1 2–3, sc 2 26–30 , c 1 6, c 2 25–28 , d 4–6, e 4–5, f 10–11, h 1 3. DISTANcES BETWEEN SETAE: v 1 –v 1 4 , v 2 –v 2 16–17 , sc 1 –sc 1 11, sc 2 –sc 2 30–32 , c 1– c 1 34–36, c 1– c 2 15–16 , c 2– c 2 65–66, d–d 34–36, e–e 17–18, e–f 3, f–f 17, h 1– h 1 13–14.

Idiosomal venter ( FIG. 4B ). VENTRAL PLATES SMOOTH . ALL VENTRAL SETAE WEAKLY BLUNT-ENDED . SETAE 3 a , 3 b , 4 b AND ( ps ) SMOOTH , OTHER VENTRAL SETAE WITH FEW MINUTE BARBS . LENGTHS OF VENTRAL SETAE : 1 a 7–8, 1 b 5, 1 c 7–8, 2 a 9–10, 2 b 8–9, 2 c 5, 3 a 6–7, 3 b 8–9, 3 c 7, 4 a 9–10, 4 b 8–9, 4 c 6–7, ps 1 1, ps 2 4.

Luciaphorus perniciosus Rack, 1983
, female: A—dorsal idiosomal seta d , B—leg I in dorsal view, C—trichobothria, D—tibia III in dorsal view, arrow points to pore-like structure.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs ( FIGS. 5 , 6 , 10D ). LEG I ( FIG. 5A ). LENGTHS OF SOLENIDIA ω 1 6, ω 2 5, φ 1 4, φ 2 3; SOLENIDION φ 1 cLAVATE, OTHER SOLENIDIA BAcULIFORM. SETAE ( pl ), pv” AND ( u ) SMOOTH AND POINTED; SETAE ( l ) OF FEMUR AND pv’ OF TARSUS SMOOTH AND BLUNT-ENDED; SETAE d , v” OF FEMUR, ( l ) OF GENU, d , l’ , v” OF TIBIA POINTED AND WEAKLY BARBED; OTHER SETAE OF LEG I (EXcEPT EUPATHIDIA) BLUNT-ENDED AND WEAKLY BARBED. LEG II ( FIG. 5B ). SOLENIDION ω 4 WEAKLY cLAVATE, SOLENIDION φ 3 BAcULIFORM. SETAE ( u ) AND tc” SMOOTH AND POINTED; v’ OF TROcHANTER AND l’ OF FEMUR SMOOTH AND BLUNT-ENDED; d , v” OF FEMUR, ( l ) AND v’ OF GENU BLUNT-ENDED AND WEAKLY BARBED; OTHER LEG SETAE SPARSELY BARBED AND POINTED. LEG III ( FIG. 6A ). SOLENIDION φ 6–7 BAcULIFORM. SETAE ( u ) AND tc” SMOOTH AND POINTED; d AND v’ OF FEMUR SMOOTH AND BLUNT- ENDED; v’ OF TROcHANTER AND v’ OF GENU BLUNT-ENDED AND WEAKLY BARBED; OTHER LEG SETAE SPARSELY BARBED AND POINTED. LEG IV ( FIG. 6B , 10D ). SOLENIDION φ 7–8 BAcULIFORM. SETAE v’ OF GENU AND TIBIA BLUNT-ENDED AND BARBED; SETAE tc’ AND u’ POINTED AND SMOOTH; OTHER LEG SETAE BLUNT-ENDED AND SMOOTH.
Material examined . TWENTY-TWO FEMALES , 9 MALES , RAISED FROM FEMALES cOLLEcTED ON Auricularia polytricha , WUFENG, TAIcHUNG , TAIWAN , 19.XI.2016 , H. SHENTU.

Remarks . IN THE ORIGINAL DEScRIPTION, RAcK (1983) ILLUSTRATED SMALL SOLENIDIA ON TIBIAE II AND III IN FEMALE . IN FAcT, SOLENIDIA ON TIBIAE III AND IV ARE ABSENT ( FIG. 9D ), BUT THERE ARE SUBcUTIcULAR INVAGINATIONS ON THE TYPIcAL LOcALITY OF TIBIAL SOLENIDIA . THESE INVAGINATIONS ARE VERY SIMILAR TO TINY SOLENIDIA ( FIG. 7 ) AND RAcK (1983) ERRONEOUSLY INTERPRETED THESE STRUcTURES AS SOLENIDIA . ALSO , IN THE ORIGINAL DEScRIPTION OF THE MALE ( RAcK 1983 ) SETA d ON TIBIA IV IS ABSENT . IN FAcT, THIS SETA IS PRESENT , BUT VERY SMALL AND TYPIcALLY HIDES UNDER THE LARGE TIBIAL SOLENIDION .
